intro: Listera major, commonly known as the greater springbeauty, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Listera major plays an important role in early pollination by attracting bees and other pollinators.
